poem:
"Prologue to the Ivory Ramparts"

In the haven of Old Oxford, 'neath the 1881 sun,
Mystery winds 'round quads where white shorts run.
Moustachioed scholars, perceptive and bright,
Intoxicate on Scotch from jug, Irish by night.
Obscure are their rites in the dark eastern arts,
While the specter of history quietly imparts.
Essentially men, strained through time's plus,
Preserve in their cloister, what's mummified in us.
